item.description:
WASTE LAND

Tried seeing this at Westport Art Center, back in the spring, but sold out before I could arrange anything, lets try again here, it looks fascinating!!!

FREE

 

 

Academy Awards®  - Nominated Best Documentary Feature   

Sundance Film Festival - Audience Award for Best World Cinema Documentary

6:30-8:30

Directed by Lucy Walker, this documentary chronicles Brazilian-born artist Vik Muniz's work creating art with the help of garbage "pickers" at the world's largest dump near Rio de Janeiro. A moderated discussion will follow the screening to discuss the film's societal implications and the relationship between Muniz's art and the concept of Shalom found in the Hebrew Bible.

Filmed over nearly three years, WASTE LAND follows renowned artist Vik Muniz as he journeys from his home base in Brooklyn to his native Brazil and the world's largest garbage dump, Jardim Gramacho, located on the outskirts of Rio de Janeiro. There he photographs an eclectic band of “catadores”—self-designated pickers of recyclable materials. Muniz’s initial objective was to “paint” the catadores with garbage. However, his collaboration with these inspiring characters as they recreate photographic images of themselves out of garbage reveals both the dignity and despair of the catadores as they begin to re-imagine their lives. Director Lucy Walker (DEVIL’S PLAYGROUND, BLINDSIGHT and COUNTDOWN TO ZERO) and co-directors João Jardim and Karen Harley have great access to the entire process and, in the end, offer stirring evidence of the transformative power of art and the alchemy of the human spirit.

http://wastelandmovie.com/index.html

Location: Community Room
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the community room, will wear the bw scarf with Piano keys.
item.name: Waste Land: Documentary Screening and Discussion
